item.description:
Join a small group of permaculturists and sub/urban homesteaders for our August gathering at member Wendy Brown's home in Old Orchard Beach (she's just off of Route One).  Learn about her family experience raising rabbits for about the last 10 years for meat (it was their first "livestock").  Learn about the breeds they have kept and their learnings about general care (housing, food, water, etc.).  Wendy and Eric can talk about (but will not be demonstrating) the processing side of things, whereby the rabbits become food for the family.  We will have a hands-on exercise in tanning some rabbit hides.  Participants can take home the tanned hides in exchange for a small cash or barter contribution.

Please only RSVP 'yes' if you really think you'll make it, as the RSVP size is super-limited on this one.  If there is alot of interest in this topic we'll look at another way to get the material out there in the future.

6:30 Potluck supper (please bring a dish/beverage to share and your own potluck kit)

7:00 Announcements and start of Rabbit Husbandry Discussion

7:30-7:45 Hands-on Tanning Exercise

8:30-ish Wrap-up/Q&A as we go along....

Wendy Brown blogs at Surviving the Suburbs and is the author of the recently published Surviving the Apocalypse in the Suburbs.
item.how_to_find_us: Best would be to pass the road and pull over off the side of the road just past Arnold Road (and not park in front of the mailboxes).

group.name: Portland Maine Permaculture & The Resilience Hub

item.name: August Potluck & Skill-share: Backyard Rabbit Husbandry & Tanning
